title: How to Make Hydrogen Peroxide Mouthwash

steps.headline: Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of lukewarm water into a dark bottle.
steps.description: You can use a glass or plastic bottle as long as it is dark-colored; light will cause the hydrogen peroxide to degrade faster. Make sure that you are using distilled or filtered water.

steps.headline: Add 1 cup (240 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide.
steps.description: Use only 3% hydrogen peroxide. Anything higher could be damaging to your oral and dental health.

steps.headline: Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients.
steps.description: Store the bottle in a cool, dark place until you are ready to use it.

steps.headline: Use the mouthwash no more than twice daily.
steps.description: Pour some mouthwash into a cup. Swish and gargle it in your mouth for about 30 seconds, then spit it out. Rinse your mouth afterwards with water, then discard any mouthwash left in the cup.

steps.headline: Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water into a dark, glass bottle.
steps.description: Use only filtered or distilled water. You can also use peppermint or spearmint hydrosol instead for a minty flavor. Avoid using plastic bottles, as the essential oils can cause the plastic to degrade over time.

steps.headline: Add ½ cup (120 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide.
steps.description: It is very important that you use 3% hydrogen peroxide; anything higher could damage your teeth. Most grocery stores sell 3% hydrogen peroxide, however.

steps.headline: Add 7 to 10 drops of essential oil.
steps.description: Peppermint or spearmint would work the best for mouthwash. You can try another type, such as: clove, grapefruit, lemon, rosemary, or sweet orange. Mixing 1 tablespoon (22.5 grams) of honey into the essential oil will help emulsify it. Skip this step if a child will be using the mouthwash.

steps.headline: Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients.
steps.description: Keep in mind that you will need to shake the bottle each time before you use the mouthwash.

steps.headline: Use the mouthwash.
steps.description: Give the mouthwash a shake, then swish and gargle a capful in your mouth for 2 minutes. Spit the mouthwash out, then rinse your mouth with water. Do not swallow the mouthwash. Store the mouthwash in a cool, dark place.

tyn: 1 cup (240 milliliters) filtered or distilled water
text: Making Simple Mouthwash Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of lukewarm water into a dark bottle. You can use a glass or plastic bottle as long as it is dark-colored; light will cause the hydrogen peroxide to degrade faster. Make sure that you are using distilled or filtered water. Add 1 cup (240 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide. Use only 3% hydrogen peroxide. Anything higher could be damaging to your oral and dental health. Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients. Store the bottle in a cool, dark place until you are ready to use it. Use the mouthwash no more than twice daily. Pour some mouthwash into a cup. Swish and gargle it in your mouth for about 30 seconds, then spit it out. Rinse your mouth afterwards with water, then discard any mouthwash left in the cup. Making Flavored Mouthwash Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water into a dark, glass bottle. Use only filtered or distilled water. You can also use peppermint or spearmint hydrosol instead for a minty flavor. Avoid using plastic bottles, as the essential oils can cause the plastic to degrade over time. Add ½ cup (120 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide. It is very important that you use 3% hydrogen peroxide; anything higher could damage your teeth. Most grocery stores sell 3% hydrogen peroxide, however. Add 7 to 10 drops of essential oil. Peppermint or spearmint would work the best for mouthwash. You can try another type, such as: clove, grapefruit, lemon, rosemary, or sweet orange. Mixing 1 tablespoon (22.5 grams) of honey into the essential oil will help emulsify it. Skip this step if a child will be using the mouthwash. Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients. Keep in mind that you will need to shake the bottle each time before you use the mouthwash. Use the mouthwash. Give the mouthwash a shake, then swish and gargle a capful in your mouth for 2 minutes. Spit the mouthwash out, then rinse your mouth with water. Do not swallow the mouthwash. Store the mouthwash in a cool, dark place.

You can use a glass or plastic bottle as long as it is dark-colored; light will cause the hydrogen peroxide to degrade faster.
Make sure that you are using distilled or filtered water.
Add 1 cup (240 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide.
Use only 3% hydrogen peroxide.
Anything higher could be damaging to your oral and dental health.
Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients.
Store the bottle in a cool, dark place until you are ready to use it.
Use the mouthwash no more than twice daily.
Pour some mouthwash into a cup.
Swish and gargle it in your mouth for about 30 seconds, then spit it out.
Rinse your mouth afterwards with water, then discard any mouthwash left in the cup.
Making Flavored Mouthwash Pour 1 cup (240 milliliters) of water into a dark, glass bottle.
Use only filtered or distilled water.
You can also use peppermint or spearmint hydrosol instead for a minty flavor.
Avoid using plastic bottles, as the essential oils can cause the plastic to degrade over time.
Add ½ cup (120 milliliters) of 3% hydrogen peroxide.
It is very important that you use 3% hydrogen peroxide; anything higher could damage your teeth.
Most grocery stores sell 3% hydrogen peroxide, however.
Add 7 to 10 drops of essential oil.
Peppermint or spearmint would work the best for mouthwash.
You can try another type, such as: clove, grapefruit, lemon, rosemary, or sweet orange.
Mixing 1 tablespoon (22.5 grams) of honey into the essential oil will help emulsify it.
Skip this step if a child will be using the mouthwash.
Close the bottle, then shake it to combine the ingredients.
Keep in mind that you will need to shake the bottle each time before you use the mouthwash.
Use the mouthwash.
Give the mouthwash a shake, then swish and gargle a capful in your mouth for 2 minutes.
Spit the mouthwash out, then rinse your mouth with water.
Do not swallow the mouthwash.
Store the mouthwash in a cool, dark place.
